texts.definition: Replays of kills in games that are shown directly after they occur.
markups: <style="Definition">Replays of kills in games that are shown directly after they occur.</style>

Deaths in games are usually important events. However, some games - especially first-person shooters - it can be difficult to perceive the circumstances in which they occurred. <style="CurrentLink">Killcams</style> are solutions to this that simply replay the moments leading up to the deaths and may be used both to highlight players' own actions and to let them know how they were killed.

<style="CurrentLink">Killcams</style> in the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Call%20of%20Duty%20series">Call of Duty</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Battlefield%20series">Battlefield series</link></style> show players how they were killed - often revealing the position of the enemies that was the cause of their deaths. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Fallout%203">Fallout 3</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Fallout:%20New%20Vegas">Fallout: New Vegas</link></style> provide <style="CurrentLink">Killcams</style> both when players have managed to kill enemies spectacularly and when they themselves have died.

The web site giantbomb.com has a [http://www.giantbomb.com/killcam/92-448/ list] of games using Killcams as well as a [http://www.giantbomb.com/camera-following-projectile/92-5060/ list]] of games using Camera Following Projectiles.

Although <style="CurrentLink">Killcams</style> can be used for any types of games, it is most often used in games with <style="Link"><link="first-person-views">First-Person Views</link></style> and there to modulate <style="Link"><link="combat">Combat</link></style>. The main design choices when making <style="CurrentLink">Killcams</style> part of games is when to use them, how to use the <style="Link"><link="cameras">Cameras</link></style> that provide the <style="Link"><link="replays">Replays</link></style> of the <style="Link"><link="combat">Combat</link></style>, and if to use <style="Link"><link="picture-picture-views">Picture-in-Picture Views</link></style> to display them or let them take over the entire display. It is an <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Diegetic%20Patterns">Diegetic Pattern</link></style>.

Deaths caused by <style="Link"><link="aim-shoot">Aim & Shoot</link></style> actions often show the <style="CurrentLink">Killcams</style> through following the flight of the projectile in a <style="Link"><link="replays">Replay</link></style>.

<style="CurrentLink">Killcams</style> are basically <style="Link"><link="cutscenes">Cutscenes</link></style> that show <style="Link"><link="replays">Replays</link></style> of the events leading up to <style="Link"><link="player-killing">Player Killing</link></style> or other important deaths. Since it can reveal enemies positions in <style="Link"><link="combat">Combat</link></style> - <style="Link"><link="sniper-locations">Sniper Locations</link></style> especially - it can lessen the chances of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Repeated%20Domination">Repeated Domination</link></style> and for games with <style="Link"><link="pvp">PvP</link></style> gameplay help create <style="Link"><link="player-balance">Player Balance</link></style>.

By giving <style="Link"><link="point-interest-indicators">Point of Interest Indicators</link></style> in moving <style="Link"><link="third-person-views">Third-Person Views</link></style>, they can let players have <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Spatial%20Engrossment">Spatial Engrossment</link></style>.
